meanings.definition: The sepals of a flower, typically forming a whorl that encloses the petals and forms a protective layer around a flower in bud.
meanings.sent1: The calyxes of the rose protected the delicate petals.
meanings.sent2: The calyxes of the daisy were green and leaf-like.
meanings.sent3: The calyxes of the tulip joked about being the flower's bodyguards.
meanings.sent4: The calyxes of the lily embraced the petals like a shield.
meanings.sent5: The calyxes of the sunflower stood tall, guarding the bloom within.

meanings.definition: The outermost group of floral parts, consisting of sepals.
meanings.sent1: Bees are attracted to the bright calyxes of the flowers.
meanings.sent2: The calyxes of the poppy were vibrant and eye-catching.
meanings.sent3: The calyxes of the daffodil waved in the breeze, greeting visitors.
meanings.sent4: The calyxes of the orchid were like a crown on the plant's head.
meanings.sent5: The calyxes of the carnation added a touch of elegance to the bouquet.
